body:
The compiler crashes when with keyword is used in cppclass definition; it should return a user-facing error message instead of crashing.

Example source code:
```
cdef cppclass Hello:
  void hello():
    with open('hello.txt') as f:
      pass
```
Output:
```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cdef cppclass Hello:
  void hello():
    with open('hello.txt') as f:
        ^
------------------------------------------------------------

hello.pyx:3:9: Compiler crash in AnalyseDeclarationsTransform

ModuleNode.body = StatListNode(hello.pyx:1:5)
StatListNode.stats[0] = CppClassNode(hello.pyx:1:5,
    base_classes = [...]/0,
    name = u'Hello')
CppClassNode.attributes[0] = CFuncDefNode(hello.pyx:2:2,
    args = [...]/0,
    modifiers = [...]/0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 431, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(hello.pyx:3:9)
File 'Nodes.py', line 7042, in analyse_declarations: WithStatNode(hello.pyx:3:9)

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "/home/yifanmai/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/Nodes.py", line 7042, in analyse_declarations
    self.enter_call.analyse_declarations(env)
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'analyse_declarations'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 5, in <module>
    ext_modules=cythonize("hello.pyx"))
  File "/home/yifanmai/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Cython/Build/Dependencies.py", line 1097, in cythonize
    cythonize_one(*args)
  File "/home/yifanmai/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Cython/Build/Dependencies.py", line 1220, in cythonize_one
    raise CompileError(None, pyx_file)
Cython.Compiler.Errors.CompileError: hello.pyx
```
title: Compiler crashes when with keyword is used in cppclass definition
